results.title: Phillip and the white colt
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, John Danischewsky and Richard Sarafian
results.brief_description: A lonely mute boy encounters a wild colt, and attempts to tame it. They become inseparable. The aniimal’s life is threatened and in the suspenseful climax the boy’s love helps to save the colt and restores his own powers of speech. Edited from the 1969 Columbia motion picture entitled ‘Run wild, run free.’

results.title: Philippines: gateway to the Far East
results.brief_description: Discusses past history, present activities, and direction of future growth in hte Philippines. Includes views of farm and city life, showing raw materials and aspects of production and education in the Philippines.

results.title: Philippines No Choice but Change
results.brief_description: This film looks at the events, issues and opposition movement behind the fall of the Marcos dictatorship through the eyes of its participants including Cory Aquino, nuns, priests, lawyers, workers, farmers and guerilla fighters. Filmed all over the country, it shows why millions of Filipinos were swept into the fight for freedom.

results.title: Philippines my Philippines
results.creator_credit: Stoney Desert, Maree Delofski and Chris Nash
results.brief_description: In 1988 three years after a triumphal wave of “people power” swept away the Marcos regime and installed Cory Aquino as Head of State, what is the real situation in the Philippines? Human rights abuses are rife, trade unions are being repressed, poverty and violence are spiralling upwards. This documentary contrasts the hopes of the revolution with the realities of prostitution and the absence of genuine land reform. It shows the connections between slumdwellers organising themselves and the rise of vigilante death squads, between a foreign investment boom and police strike-breakers, between Australian development aid to poor peasants and counter-insurgency strategies. The film combines startling images of beauty and terror with the story of a people betrayed.

results.title: Philharmonic safari: the London Philharmonic Orchestra "down under"
results.creator_credit: Shepherd Baker Studios and Don Shepherd
results.brief_description: A magical documentary where the story is told through the combination of stunning images, beautiful sounds of orchestral music, and minimal commentary. It is a contrast of seasons and of cultures - winter in London, summer in Australia. This is a musical journey that takes you half-way around the globe with one of the world’s greatest orchestras, the London Philharmonic Orchestra. The story begins in a snow-covered wintery London with a performance by the London Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Klaus Tennstedt, at the Royal Festival Hall. Next, the orchestra boards a Qantas flight bound for Perth and their final destination, the magnificent Leeuwin Estate, a vineyard 250 kilometres south of Perth. It is here under the Australian night sky that the London Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Avi Ostrowski, will perform to an audience of around 4,500 enthusiastic and appreciative music lovers.

results.title: Philby, Burgess & Maclean
results.creator_credit: Granada International Productions, Jeremy Wallington and Gordon Flemyng
results.brief_description: During the 1950’s the world was shocked by the defection to the Soviet Union of Guy Burgess and Donald Maclean, highly placed officials in the diplomatic service. Years later with the web slowly closing around him, Kim Philby defected also. Although in line for the Number Two job in the British Secret Service, he was also a full colonel in the KGB, whom he had secretly served throughout his career. This excellent dramatisation recreates the factual evidence which stunned a nation

results.title: Philately
results.brief_description: Introduces a study of postage stamps with a glimpse of some other outlets of man’s collecting instinct. Continues with a history of the development of courier and postal services from the time of the pharaohs and the Roman Empire to the modern world system of communication.

results.title: Philadelphia, here I come!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Donald McCann plays a young man Gar, bored with the monotony of his life in rural Ireland, who seeks adventure in the wider world by deciding to live with his aunt in Philadelphia. On the eve of his departure Gar reflects upon his past, on what might have been and upon his relationship with his emotionally distant father. His inner turmoil and rage are relayed via his alter ego (played by Des Cave) who gives a caustic running commentary about Gar’s shortcomings and those of his friends and family. A funny and bittersweet adaptation of the Brian Friel play of the same name, the narrative is a rumination upon identity, nationality, maturity and regret. Cast also includes: Siobhan McKenna and Eamon A. Kelly.

results.title: Philadelphia with love
results.creator_credit: Nassau Film Productions, Bell Telephone Company of Pennsylvania and James A. Love
results.brief_description: Shows the modern city of Philadelphia, a beneficiary of urban renewal, a city where sports and cultural opportunities are readily available. Describes the parks, museums, institutions of higher learning, the city government and the office of the mayor. “Philadelphia with love” sung by Sergio Franchi. Narration by Joel Craeger.
